snippet: Facing increasing criticism for its plan to honor Ayaan Hirsi Ali, a women’s rights advocate who has called Islam a “nihilistic cult of death,” Brandeis University decided against awarding the degree.
abstract: Brandeis University bows to growing criticism and reverses course, saying it will not award an honorary degree to Ayaan Hirsi Ali, campaigner for women’s rights and a fierce critic of Islam, who has called the religion 'a destructive, nihilistic cult of death.'

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and TANZINA VEGA

lead_paragraph: Facing increasing criticism for its plan to honor Ayaan Hirsi Ali, a women’s rights advocate who has called Islam a “nihilistic cult of death,” Brandeis University decided against awarding the degree.

headline.main: Brandeis Cancels Plan to Give Honorary Degree to Ayaan Hirsi Ali, a Critic of Islam
headline.print_headline: Brandeis Cancels Plan to Give Honorary Degree to Rights Advocate, a Critic of Islam

keywords.value: American Enterprise Institute for Public Policy Research
keywords.name: organizations
